label: Academic Research
definition: Purposes associated with conducting or assisting with research conducted in an academic context e.g. within universities.

label: Access
definition: To acquire data from a data repository or other data sharing system.

label: Access Type
definition: The approach for making data available for use by others, for example open access or controlled access.

label: Account Numbers
definition: The presence of the personally identifiable information element of an account number.

label: Any Other Unique Identifying Numbers or Codes
definition: The presence of any other personally identifiable information elements.

label: Approve
definition: To provide permission to perform the requested action.

label: Approved Party
definition: The party receiving approval.

label: Approved Purpose
definition: The allowed activity or purpose for which the operator wishes to use the asset.

label: Approving Party
definition: The party providing approval.

label: Biometric Identifiers
definition: The presence of the personally identifiable information element of a biometric identifier.

label: Certificate License Numbers
definition: The presence of the personally identifiable information element of a certificate license number.

label: Certification
definition: An attestation that an official status has been earned by satisfying defined requirements, or the act of providing such a status, as proof that something has happened or defined standards have been met or will be upheld in the future.

label: Certification Organization
definition: An organization that grants or approves certifications or certificates.

label: Classify
definition: To organize data by relevant categories so that it may be used and protected more efficiently.

label: Collect
definition: The process of gathering and measuring information on variables of interest, in an established systematic fashion that enables one to answer stated research questions, test hypotheses, and evaluate outcomes.

label: Complete Training
definition: To complete training.

label: Consent
definition: The IRB-approved written record that is in compliance with the Common Rule (45 CFR 46) and as applicable, Protection of Human Subjects rules (21 CFR 50), and is used to demonstrate the consent by a participant or guardian to participate in research.

label: Consent Requirement
definition: A requirement to obtain consent from a participant or organization.

label: Contract
definition: A contract is an agreement between parties, creating mutual obligations that are enforceable by law. (source: https://www.law.cornell.edu/wex/contract)

label: Controlled Access
definition: Established processes for verifying appropriate use of shared data, such as requiring verification of requestor identity, committee approval of proposed research use, and signing a data use agreement to access protected data. (modified from source: https://grants.nih.gov/grants/guide/notice-files/NOT-OD-22-213.html)

label: Data Access Committee
definition:
A group of individuals who review all requests for access to datasets from external
requestors and is composed of individuals with expertise in science, policy, or
bioinformatics resources.

label: Data Coordinating Center
definition: Academic and commercial data management and study oversight organizations, including contract research organizations, whose responsibilities include providing some or all the following services: study administration, financial management, protocol administration, data management, stakeholder communication and coordination, quality assurance, site monitoring, safety, regulatory, document management, post-study management, and close-out activities. (source:  https://www.niddk.nih.gov/-/media/Files/Research-Funding/Process/NIDDK-Guidance_DCC-Management-of-CCAs_Final_Version-1,-d-,1_OD-Approved_External-Website.pdf)

label: Data Enclave
definition: A secure network through which confidential data, such as identifiable information from census data, can be stored and disseminated. In a virtual data enclave a researcher can access the data from their own computer but cannot download or remove it from the remote server. Higher security data can be accessed through a physical data enclave where a researcher is required to access the data from a monitored room where the data is stored on non-network computers. (source: https://nnlm.gov/guides/data-thesaurus/data-enclave)

label: Data Provider
definition: Institutions, organizations, and researchers that collect data from research participants or that collect administrative data and may also submit the data to a repository for sharing.

label: Data Repository
definition: A physical location or virtual system for preserving, maintaining, and providing access to data. (modified from source: https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-content/uploads/2022/05/05-2022-Desirable-Characteristics-of-Data-Repositories.pdf)

label: Data Requester
definition: An individual or organization that requests access to a dataset that is not the participant.

label: Dataset
definition: A collection of related data records.

label: Data Use Agreement
definition: A document which establishes who is permitted to use and receive data, and the permitted uses and disclosures of such information by the recipient. (modified from source: https://www.hhs.gov/hipaa/for-professionals/special-topics/emergency-preparedness/data-use-agreement/index.html)

label: Dates
definition: The presence of the personally identifiable information element of dates. Includes birth dates and death dates.

label: Deidentification Method
definition: The method to remove the identifiers or any information that could directly identify a participant from a dataset to mitigate privacy risks to that participant.

label: Deidentified Dataset
definition: A set of information that has had personally identifiable information (PII; e.g. a person’s name, email address, or social security number), including identifying protected health information (PHI; e.g., medical history, test results, and insurance information) removed.

label: Deidentify
definition: To remove identifying information. De-identified data is participant information that has had personally identifiable information (PII; e.g. a participant’s name, email address, or social security number), including protected health information (PHI; e.g. medical history, test results, and insurance information) removed. This is normally performed when sharing the data from a registry or clinical study to prevent a participant from being directly or indirectly identified. (modified from source: https://toolkit.ncats.nih.gov/glossary/de-identified-patient-data/)

label: Determination
definition: Outcome of a ruling or legal decision.

label: Device Identifiers and Serial Numbers
definition: The presence of the personally identifiable information element of device identifiers and serial numbers.

label: Disclosure Review Body
definition: A group of individuals that establishes and operates processes and policies to ensure the public release of data products that do not reveal any information about the participants included in those datasets.

label: Email Addresses
definition: The presence of the personally identifiable information element of an email address.

label: Fax Numbers
definition: The presence of the personally identifiable information element of a fax number.

label: Full Face Photos and Comparable Images
definition: The presence of the personally identifiable information element of a full face photo or comparable image.

label: Geographic Data
definition: The presence of the personally identifiable information elements of geographic data. Includes street address, city, state, zip code, or elements of a geocode.

label: Government Organization
definition: An international, federal, state, tribal, or local government organization. Inclusive of departments or divisions within a larger government organization.

label: Guardian
definition: An individual who is authorized under applicable State or local law to consent on behalf of a child to general medical care. Inclusive of a child’s biological or adoptive parent. (source: https://www.ecfr.gov/current/title-45/subtitle-A/subchapter-A/part-46/subpart-D/section-46.402)

label: Health Plan Beneficiary Numbers
definition: The presence of the personally identifiable information element of a health plan beneficiary or member number.

label: IP Addresses
definition: The presence of the personally identifiable information element of an IP address.

label: Institutional Review Board
definition: An Institutional Review Board (IRB) is the institutional entity charged with providing ethical and regulatory oversight of research involving human subjects, typically at the site of the research study. (source: https://orwh.od.nih.gov/toolkit/human-subjects-protections/institutional-review-board)

label: Law (regulations and statutes)
definition: A system of rules created and enforced by governmental bodies that regulate the behavior of individuals, organizations, and governmental entities. Inclusive of statutes and regulations.

label: Limited Dataset
definition: A set of information about a participant that excludes 16 direct identifiers specified in the HIPAA Privacy Rule and may be used or disclosed, for purposes of research, public health, or health care operations, without obtaining either a participant's Authorization or a waiver or an alteration of authorization for its use and disclosure, with a data use agreement. (modified from source: https://privacyruleandresearch.nih.gov/pr_08.asp)

label: Link
definition: To combine information from a variety of data sources for the same participant. (source: https://hcup-us.ahrq.gov/datainnovations/raceethnicitytoolkit/or19.jsp) Synonymous with record linkage.

label: Linkage Method
definition: The method used for linkage. Inclusive of PPRL and non-PPRL methods.

label: Make Determination
definition: To reach a decision or draw conclusions.

label: Medical Record Numbers (MRNs)
definition: The presence of the personally identifiable information element of a medical record number.

label: Minor Participant
definition: Refers to children or participants who have not attained the legal age for consent to treatments or procedures involved in the research, under the applicable law of the jurisdiction in which the research will be conducted. (modified from source: https://www.hhs.gov/ohrp/regulations-and-policy/guidance/faq/children-research/index.html)

label: Names
definition: The presence of the personally identifiable information element of a name. Includes first, middle, and last name.

label: Obtain Approval
definition: To obtain verifiable approval to perform the requested action.

label: Output
definition: The result of a process.

label: Participant
definition: A healthy human or a patient who is or becomes a participant in research. (modified from source: https://policymanual.nih.gov/3014-001#C)

label: Phone Numbers
definition: The presence of the personally identifiable information element of a phone number.

label: Policy
definition: A formal statement of intent or plan of action that is adopted by an organization  and defines specific procedures, rules, or regulations that individuals are expected to adhere to or follow.

label: Principal Investigator
definition: The investigator with the overall responsibility for the designing, conducting, and reporting of the research, and must assure both the protocol and the research team’s actions are compliant with law, regulation, and NIH policy, even when certain aspects of the research are delegated to other investigators. (modified from source: https://ohsrp.nih.gov/confluence/display/ohsrp/Chapter+2+-+Roles+and+Responsibilities+of+the+Principal+Investigator#:~:text=The%20NIH%20Principal%20Investigator%20(PI,research%20to%20appropriately%20qualified%20individuals)

label: Prior Linkage
definition: A set of information about prior linkages of a dataset.

label: Privacy Board
definition: A group of individuals who review and approve research uses and disclosures of data to ensure that the privacy rights of research participants are protected.

label: Process
definition: A procedure that individuals are expected to adhere to or follow.

label: Reidentify
definition: A general term for any process that re-establishes the relationship between identifying data and a participant. (modified from source: https://csrc.nist.gov/glossary/term/re_identification)

label: Research Use
definition: Working with data for scientific research or other analytical purposes.

label: Review Committee
definition: A group of individuals convened to review materials, provide approvals, and issue determinations on requested actions.

label: Safe Harbor Method
definition: A method for deidentification by removal of 18 HIPAA identifiers. (modified from source: https://www.hhs.gov/hipaa/for-professionals/privacy/special-topics/de-identification/index.html#safeharborguidance)

label: Secondary Link
definition: To link a dataset for a secondary purpose distinct from the original or primary intended purpose.

label: Share
definition: The act of making an asset such as a dataset available for use by others.

label: Sign
definition: Signing a document or agreement.

label: Social Security Numbers (SSNs)
definition: The presence of the personally identifiable information element of a social security number.

label: Submit
definition: To submit a document such as a form, application, or protocol.

label: URLs
definition: The presence of the personally identifiable information element of a URL.

label: Vehicle Identifiers and Serial Numbers
definition: The presence of the personally identifiable information element of vehicle identifiers and serial numbers.

label: Agreement
definition: A Policy that grants the assignee a Rule over an Asset from an assigner.

label: Anonymize
definition: To anonymize all or parts of the Asset.

label: Assignee
definition: The Party is the recipient of the Rule.

label: Assigner
definition: The Party is the issuer of the Rule.

label: Consented Party
definition: The party receiving consent on an asset

label: Consenting Party
definition: The party granting consent on an asset

label: Constraint
definition: A boolean expression that refines the semantics of an Action and Party/Asset Collection or declare the conditions applicable to a Rule.

label: Contracted Party
definition: The Party who is being contracted.

label: Contracting Party
definition: The Party who is offering the contract.

label: eq
definition: Equals.

label: Obtain Consent
definition: To obtain verifiable consent to perform the requested action in relation to the Asset.

label: Policy (ODRL)
definition: A non-empty group of Permissions and/or Prohibitions.

label: Purpose
definition: A defined purpose for exercising the action of the Rule.

label: Recipient
definition: The party receiving the result/outcome of exercising the action of the Rule.

label: Request
definition: A Policy that proposes a Rule over an Asset from an assignee.

label: Review Policy
definition: To review the Policy applicable to the asset

label: Rule
definition: An abstract concept that represents the common characteristics of Permissions, Prohibitions, and Duties.

label: Sell
definition: To transfer the ownership of the Asset to a third party with compensation and while deleting the original asset.

label: Transfer
definition: To transfer the ownership of the Asset in perpetuity.

label: Virtual Location
definition: An identified location of the IT communication space which is relevant for exercising the action of the Rule.

label: Metadata
definition: A set of data that describes and gives information about other data.

label: Assent
definition: An assent form is used to express willingness to participate in research by persons who are by definition, too young to give informed consent but are old enough to understand the proposed research in general, its expected risks and possible benefits, and the activities expected of them as subjects. An assent form is a type of consent form.
